definition: A set of rules that allow different software applications to communicate with each other.
The Document Object Model represents the page structure that JavaScript can interact with.
Cascading Style Sheets control the visual layout and appearance of web elements.
A version control system for tracking changes to code and collaborating with others.
A scripting language used to create interactive behaviors on web pages.
A modular, reusable UI element often used in frameworks like React or Vue.
